word_mean: 氧：一种气体元素，游离存在于空气中和结合于大多数非元素的固体、液体和气体中，原子序数为8，原子量为15.999，符号为O
氧有三种同位素，另两种的原子量分别为16.17和18(重氧)。按重量计，氧占空气的20％
氧是植物和动物呼吸中的必要物质
氧虽不燃，但却是支持燃烧所必需的
氧形成三代酸的特异成分。在某些肺病和心脏病时氧被用做吸入治疗剂

sentence.Network_en: Ozone is a highly reactive form of oxygen gas.
sentence.Network_cn: 臭氧是一种非常活跃的氧气形态。

sentence.Network_en: Ozone is produced by the reaction between oxygen and ultra-violet light.
sentence.Network_cn: 臭氧由氧气和紫外线发生反应而产生。

sentence.Network_en: Smoking and drinking interfere with your body's ability to process oxygen.
sentence.Network_cn: 抽烟与酗酒有碍身体处理氧气的能力。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: from French (principe) oxygène 'acidifying constituent' (because at first it was held to be the essential component in the formation of acids)

entry.def: Oxygen is a colourless gas that exists in large quantities in the air. All plants and animals need oxygen in order to live.

example.ex: The human brain needs to be without oxygen for only four minutes before permanent damage occurs.
example.tran: 人的大脑缺氧4分钟后便会造成永久性损伤。

means.word_mean: 1. a nonmetallic bivalent element that is normally a colorless odorless tasteless nonflammable diatomic gas; constitutes 21 percent of the atmosphere by volume; the most abundant element in the earth's crust

auth_sentence.content: Photosynthesis replaces carbon dioxide in the atmosphere with oxygen.

auth_sentence.content: It then delivers oxygen-rich blood back to your heart.

Sentence.sentence: He displays fire fighters' equipment, including the oxygen mask, which he encourages his listeners to play with and put on.
He provides oxygen masks to children free of charge
The higher one climbs, the less oxygen there is in the air.
You breathe less when you sleep, so you get less oxygen

sentences.en: Oxygen is one of the basic elements of substance.
sentences.cn: 氧是物质的基本元素之一。

sentences.en: No living things can live without oxygen.
sentences.cn: 没有氧生物就无法生存。

jushi.chinese: 没有氧生物就无法生存。
